definitions.definition: A shallow deformation in the surface of an object, produced by an impact.
definitions.example: The crash produced a dent in the left side of the car.

definitions.definition: A type of maize/corn with a relatively soft outer hull, and a soft type of starch that shrinks at maturity to leave an indentation in the surface of the kernel.
(by extension) A sudden negative change, such as loss, damage, weakening, consumption or diminution, especially one produced by an external force, event or action
definitions.example: That purchase put a bit of a dent in my wallet.

definitions.definition: To impact something, producing a dent.
To develop a dent or dents.
definitions.example: Copper is soft and dents easily.

definitions.definition: A tooth, as of a card, a gear wheel, etc.
A slot or a wire in a reed
